verses.verse: For the Chief Musician. A Psalm for the sons of Korah. Jehovah<WH3068>, thou hast been favorable<WH7521> unto thy land<WH776>; Thou hast brought back<WH7725> the captivity<WH7622> of Jacob<WH3290>.
Thou hast forgiven<WH5375> the iniquity<WH5771> of thy people<WH5971>; Thou hast covered<WH3680> all their sin<WH2403>. Selah<WH5542>
Thou hast taken away<WH622> all thy wrath<WH5678>; Thou hast turned<WH7725> thyself from the fierceness<WH2740> of thine anger<WH639>.
Turn <WH7725> us<WH430>, O God of our salvation<WH3468>, And cause thine indignation<WH3708> toward us to cease<WH6565>.
Wilt thou be angry<WH599> with us for ever<WH5769>? Wilt thou draw out<WH4900> thine anger<WH639> to all<WH1755> generations<WH1755>?
Wilt thou not quicken<WH2421> us again<WH7725>, That thy people<WH5971> may rejoice in thee<WH8055>?
Show <WH7200> us thy lovingkindness<WH2617>, O Jehovah<WH3068>, And grant<WH5414> us thy salvation<WH3468>.

I will hear<WH8085> what God<WH410> Jehovah<WH3068> will speak<WH1696>; For he will speak<WH1696> peace<WH7965> unto his people<WH5971>, and to his saints<WH2623>: But let them not turn again<WH7725> to folly<WH3690>.
Surely his salvation<WH3468> is nigh<WH7138> them that fear<WH3373> him<WH3519>, That glory may dwell<WH7931> in our land<WH776>.
Mercy <WH2617> and truth<WH571> are met together<WH6298>; Righteousness<WH6664> and peace<WH7965> have kissed each other<WH5401>.
Truth <WH571> springeth out<WH6779> of the earth<WH776>; And righteousness<WH6664> hath looked down<WH8259> from heaven<WH8064>.
Yea <WH3068>, Jehovah will give<WH5414> that which is good<WH2896>; And our land<WH776> shall yield<WH5414> its increase<WH2981>.
Righteousness <WH6664> shall go<WH1980> before<WH6440> him<WH7760>, And shall make his footsteps<WH6471> a way to walk in<WH1870>.
